summary: This is an email chain between defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim and the chambers of Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the service of Ghislaine Maxwell's response to motions to quash a subpoena issued to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program (EVCP). The correspondence confirms coordination with the government on redactions and service to moving parties.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney corresponding with the court and government regarding the service of Maxwell's legal filing. She signs off on emails and provides her contact information.

persons.name: Nathan NYSD Chambers
persons.role: Chambers of Judge Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Recipient and sender of emails requesting confirmation of service for a legal filing in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.role: Attorney at Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.
persons.context: Attorney who submitted Ghislaine Maxwell's response to the court under temporary seal, acting at the request of Jeffrey Pagliuca.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney who requested Nicole Simmons to submit Maxwell's legal response to the court. Mentioned in the email chain.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Copied on the email chain regarding the legal filing in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The presiding judge in the case 'U.S. v. Maxwell, Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)'. Her chambers are involved in the correspondence.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case. The correspondence is about serving her legal response to motions to quash a subpoena she issued.

connections.description: Sternheim is acting as defense counsel for Maxwell, as indicated by her correspondence regarding Maxwell's legal filings.
Simmons states she is acting at the request of Pagliuca in submitting a legal filing for Maxwell.
Sternheim is in direct communication with the judge's chambers to confirm procedural steps regarding service of a legal document.
Simmons submitted a legal filing directly to Judge Nathan's chambers.

events.title: Submission of Maxwell's Response to Court
events.description: Attorney Nicole Simmons, at Jeff Pagliuca's request, submits Ghislaine Maxwell's Response to Letter Motions to Quash her Rule 17(c) subpoena to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program to the court under temporary seal.

events.title: Coordination on Document Redaction and Service
events.description: Defense counsel Bobbi Sternheim coordinates with the government to apply redactions to the legal response and then serve it on the moving parties, confirming completion on November 23.

locations.context: The law office address of Bobbi C. Sternheim.
The law office address of Nicole Simmons at Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team filed a response to motions seeking to quash a subpoena she issued to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program (EVCP).
The filing was submitted to the court under a temporary seal to allow the government to propose necessary redactions before service on other parties.
The correspondence reveals a procedural protocol between Maxwell's defense and the government for handling sensitive filings related to victim compensation.
The document shows multiple attorneys (Sternheim, Simmons, Pagliuca, Menninger) working on Maxwell's defense in a coordinated manner.
